const DATA_MAX = 1050
 Implements SLIP(Seriel Line Internet Protocol) transfer over serial communication(RS-232). Uses the standard: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1055 Except:

Detailed Description

Function Documentation

void close ( )

Closes connection.

Precondition:
A serial connection is open.
Postcondition:
The connection is closed.
int connect ( )

Makes connection over "/dev/ttyusb0".

Precondition:
Another serial connection is not open.(Remember to close after using this connection)
Postcondition:
A connection is made(Returns '1' else '0').
size_t receivePackage ( char  data[])

Receives a package.

Precondition:
A connection is open. Data can contain atleast DATA_MAX * 2.
Postcondition:
'data' now contains the data from the package and the number of bytes received is returned.(0 if error)
void sendPacket ( char *  data,
size_t  n 
)

Sends a package.

Precondition:
A connection is open. Data contains minimum 'n' number of bytes. 'n' is less than or equal to DATA_MAX.
Postcondition:
'n' number of bytes from 'data' is sent.

Variable Documentation

const DATA_MAX = 1050

Implements SLIP(Seriel Line Internet Protocol) transfer over serial communication(RS-232). Uses the standard: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1055 Except:

  • Uses one kind of byte for start and finish('A')
  • Can send a maximum of DATA_MAX characters at a time(Can actually be more because of byte-stuffing)
